description: Creates a placement group in which to launch instances. The strategy of the placement group determines how the instances are organized within the group. A cluster placement group is a logical grouping of instances within a single Availability Zone that benefit from low network latency, high network throughput. A spread placement group places instances on distinct hardware. A partition placement group places groups of instances in different partitions, where instances in one partition do not share the same hardware with instances in another partition. For more information, see Placement groups in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to apply to the new placement group. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: SpreadLevel
parameters.description: Determines how placement groups spread instances. Host --- You can use host only with Outpost placement groups. Rack --- No usage restrictions.

parameters.name: GroupName
parameters.description: A name for the placement group. Must be unique within the scope of your account for the Region. Constraints: Up to 255 ASCII characters.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the placement group.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the placement group.

nested_items.name: PartitionCount
nested_items.description: The number of partitions. Valid only if strategy is set to partition.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the placement group.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags applied to the placement group.

nested_items.name: GroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the placement group.

nested_items.name: SpreadLevel
nested_items.description: The spread level for the placement group. Only Outpost placement groups can be spread across hosts.
